intro: Lasiosiphon pubescens var. multifolius, commonly known as the hairy lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticultural collections.
